default: (a) a {@item dungeoneer's pack|phb} or (b) an {@item explorer's pack|phb}

classFeature.name: Needle
entries: When you wield your longsword, it gains the Finesse property. Your longsword is referred to as your Needle in other class features.

entries.name: Relentless Strikes
entries: When you miss a melee attack roll with your Needle, you can immediately make another attack. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until the start of your next turn.

entries.name: Perfect Parry
entries: As a reaction when another creature hits you with an attack, you can make an attack roll with your Needle. If it matches or exceeds their attack roll, you take no damage from the attack.

classFeature.name: Silk
entries: Your body has a natural ability to create Silk, a manifestation of the Weave's magical power. Your ability to gather and make use of it is represented by a number of Silk points. Your Weaver level determines the maximum number of Silk points you can have, as shown in the Weaver table.
You can spend these points to fuel various Weaver skills. You start knowing one such feature: Bind. You learn more skills as you gain levels in this class.

entries.name: Gaining Silk
entries: You gain Silk by damaging a hostile creature with your Needle. (Whether a creature is "hostile" is determined by your DM.) Doing so restores 1 Silk point. You recover an extra Silk point when you score a Critical Hit, and all of your Silk points are restored when your character level increases.

While you are taking a warm bath, you recover 2 Silk points at the start of each of your turns. This can happen in a bath house or a hot spring in the wilderness. Alternatively, an adventuring party can create a bath, e.g. with {@spell Create or Destroy Water|XPHB} along with {@spell Prestidigitation|XPHB} to heat it up.

entries.name: Silk and Shadow
entries: When you take Necrotic damage, you lose 2 Silk points.

entries.name: Silk Ability
entries: Intelligence is your Silk attack ability, since your power stems from your mind's ability to bind itself to techniques held by other Weavers. You use your Intelligence modifier whenever a feature refers to your Silk modifier.

classFeature.name: Bind
entries: As an action, you can spend 9 Silk points to rapidly heal your wounds. When you do so, any other creature can use its reaction to make a single meelee attack against you if it is close enough to reach you. (This is similar to an {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB}, but it can take place even if an effect such as the {@action Disengage|XPHB} action would normally prevent such an attack.)
If you use Bind while airborne, you hover in place until it completes.

If you take damage during this action, you immediately lose all your Silk points and fail to recover any Hit Points. Otherwise, roll a number of d6s equal to half your Weaver level (rounded up), and for each die rolled, add your Constitution modifier. You recover Hit Points equal to the result.

This is similar to spending {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB|Hit Dice} during a short rest, but your Hit Dice are not consumed. For example, if a level 7 Weaver with a +2 Constitution modifier uses Bind successfully, they will recover 4d6 + 8 Hit Points.

classFeature.name: Silk Skills
entries: {@filter Silk Skills|optionalfeatures|feature type=SS|source=Weaver} allow you to channel your Silk into offensive power. At 2nd level, you can use one such skill: {@optfeature Silkspear|Weaver}.

Using a Silk Skill costs 4 Silk points. The skills you have access to will evolve as you gain levels in this class, but you can only have one Silk Skill prepared at a time. You can switch to a different skill at the end of a short or long rest.

entries.name: Silk Dice
entries: Your Silk Dice are a number of d8s equal to your Proficiency Bonus. These dice determine the damage of your Silk Skills.

classFeature.name: Silk Heart
entries: You gain the power to generate Silk within your body. If at the start of your turn you have zero Silk points, you regain one Silk point.

classFeature.name: Weaver Crest
entries: You gain a Crest to define your Weaver subclass.
A subclass is a specialization that grants you features at certain Weaver levels. For the rest of your career, you gain each of your Crest's features that are of your Weaver level or lower.

classFeature.name: Tools
entries: You can augment your power by equipping various tools. The tools you can use depend on your Weaver level and the Crest you choose.
You can equip and unequip tools when you take a short or long rest.

entries.name: Red Tools
entries: You may use up to two different {@filter Red Tools|optionalfeatures|feature type=WT:R|source=Weaver} with a single action (or bonus action, if both have the Quick property).
If you are hiding, using a tool with the Hidden or Quick property will not reveal your location.
Unless stated otherwise, a tool's DC for checks or saving throws is calculated as 8 + your Proficiency Bonus + your Strength or Dexterity modifier (whichever is higher).

entries.name: Optional: Gathering Tools
entries: Your DM may require some or all of your tools to be found somewhere in the world before you can equip them. If you find a tool this way, you do not need to meet its level requirement to equip it.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify. You gain this feature again at Weaver levels 8, 12, 14, and 16.

classFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: You can attack twice instead of once whenever you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action on your turn.

classFeature.name: Swift Step
entries: You learn how to sprint with unnatural speed, as though gliding upon Silk.
You can take the {@action Dash|XPHB} action as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}. When you Dash, you also receive the following benefits:

items: You gain the effects of the {@action Disengage|XPHB} action.
Any Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics|XPHB}) checks made during this turn have advantage.

entries: You don't benefit from this feature if you are wielding a Shield or wearing Medium or Heavy Armor.

classFeature.name: Drifter's Cloak
entries: You master the Drifter's Cloak.

classFeature.name: Cling Grip
entries: You gain a climbing speed equal to your walking speed. (The {@action Dash|XPHB} action does not increase your climbing speed.)

classFeature.name: Evasion
entries: When you're subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw and only half damage if you fail.
You don't benefit from this feature if you have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition.

classFeature.name: Needolin
entries: You gain the ability to string your Needle with Silk and play it as a musical instrument. When you do so, you lose 1 Silk point for every 6 seconds that pass. This lasts until you dismiss the Needolin (no action required), when you are reduced to zero Silk points, or when you take damage.
When making a Charisma (Performance) check to perform with your Needolin, you can treat a d20 roll of 14 or lower as a 15.
Additionally, while the Needolin is playing, it has the following effects within a 15-foot radius:

items: You gain the effects of {@spell Detect Magic|XPHB} within this radius: you see a faint aura around any visible creature or object in the area that bears any magical effects, and if an effect was created by a spell, you learn the spell's school of magic.
The Needolin might open certain doors or activate other magical effects, at your DM's discretion.
Other creatures feel an urge to sing along.

entries: If nothing useful can be achieved at your current location, you are made aware of this and can dismiss the Needolin before any Silk points are lost.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Clawline
entries: You can throw the Silk-strung needle like a harpoon and charge towards it. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can spend 1 Silk point to throw the Needle at any target you can see within 25 feet of you. If the target is a climbable surface, you immediately launch toward it and can start climbing.

Otherwise, make a ranged attack roll with your Needle. If the attack hits, you roll damage for your Needle, but you don't add your ability modifier or regain any Silk. Whether it hits or misses, you immediately charge to the target and can perform a melee Needle attack as part of the same bonus action.

classFeature.name: Faydown Cloak
entries: You master the Faydown Cloak.

classFeature.name: Silk Hearts
entries: You can regain 1 Silk point at the start of your turn, up to a maximum of 2 Silk points.

classFeature.name: Crest Feature
entries: You are granted an improvement by your Weaver Crest.

classFeature.name: Beastling Call
entries: You learn a new melody that can be played with your Needolin.
Choose one willing non-humanoid creature (or a family of creatures) to form a deep bond with, and spend 30 seconds and 5 Silk points playing the Beastling Call.

From then on, as an action you can spend 1 Silk point to play the Beastling Call, and the creature(s) will come to your aid, whether by helping you in combat, acting as a mount, or assisting you and your companions in other ways.
The Beastling Call grants the creature(s) a capability to rapidly traverse great distances to reach you, though your DM may rule that some locations are unreachable.
Additionally, you gain proficiency in the {@skill Animal Handling|XPHB} skill. If you are already proficient, you instead add double your proficiency bonus to these checks.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Silk Hearts
entries: You can regain 1 Silk point at the start of your turn, up to a maximum of 3 Silk points.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Sylphsong
entries: You regain all expended Silk points whenever you complete a short or long rest.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Silk Soar
entries: You can launch to tremendous heights.

You can use Silk Soar anytime there is a ceiling, overhang, or other object directly above you. As an action, you spend 1 Silk point and throw the Needle to the ceiling. You then launch vertically at a speed of 80 feet per round until you hit the ceiling, take damage, or dismiss the Silk Soar (no action required). You resume holding your Needle when the Silk Soar ends.

classFeature.name: Elegy of the Deep
entries: You gain the ability to travel back in time and steal powerful relics.
As an action, you can spend 1 Silk point to play a unique melody with your Needolin. This cannot be performed while engaged in combat with hostile creatures.

You, and a number of companions up to your Silk modifier, are transported to a dream of the past. You choose the amount of time to travel back; it must be at least 1 year. Actions you perform within the dream have no effect on the real world. If you or a companion is reduced to zero hit points, you are returned to the present, with your bodies in the same condition they were in before the dream started.

At any point, you can choose to leave the dream (no action required). When you do, any objects from the dream that you or your companions are wearing or carrying return with you. Upon your return, these items immediately vanish from their present location and are in your possession in the same condition they were in within the dream.

entries.name: Note to the Player
entries: Elegy of the Deep can create a lot of work for the DM—make sure to discuss with them prior to using this feature.

classFeature.name: Epic Boon
entries: You gain an {@filter Epic Boon feat|feats|category=EB} or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify. {@feat Boon of Irresistible Offense|XPHB} is recommended.

classFeature.name: Everbloom
entries: Necrotic damage no longer causes you to lose Silk points.

You can manifest the Everbloom as an action, and each Fiend and Undead of your choice within 30 feet of you must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition Frightened|XPHB} and {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} for 1 minute. During that time, it tries to move as far from you as it can on its turns.
After a creature succeeds on its saving throw, it cannot be affected by this feature for 24 hours.

subclassFeature.name: Hunter Crest
entries: The Hunter Crest grants the following tool slots as you gain levels in this class:

subclassFeature.name: Lurk
entries: When you use one or more Red Tools, you can Hide as part of that same action or bonus action.

subclassFeature.name: Focus
entries: Your Focus is represented by a numerical value that starts at zero and increases by one each time you successfully land a Needle attack on a hostile creature. When you take damage or complete a short or long rest your Focus value resets to zero.
If your Focus value is 4 or greater, you deal an extra 1d4 damage with your Needle attacks. (This also applies to the attack that increases the Focus value to 4.)

subclassFeature.name: Improved Focus
entries: Your Hunter's Focus improves when you reach 11th level. You can use the largest die size less than or equal to your current Focus value, up to a maximum of 1d12.
For example, if your Focus value is 6 or 7, your Needle attacks deal an extra 1d6 damage, and a value of 12 or more gives an extra 1d12 damage.

subclassFeature.name: Reaper Crest
entries: The Reaper Crest grants the following tool slots as you gain levels in this class:

subclassFeature.name: Reaper Bind
entries: Recovering Hit Points using your Bind allows you to reap additional Silk from enemies.

When you damage a hostile creature with your Needle, you can attempt to gather additional Silk by making an Acrobatics check. If the check's result matches or exceeds the target's AC, then you regain an extra Silk point from that attack, and from every other melee Needle attack you make that damages this creature until the start of your next turn.
If the Acrobatics check does not meet the target's AC, you cannot attempt this check against that creature until the start of your next turn.
Your ability to reap additional Silk begins when your Bind completes and lasts for 1 minute or until you take damage.

subclassFeature.name: Cleave
entries: If there are two or more targets within your Needle's reach, you can damage each of them with a single attack. Your attack and damage rolls apply to all targets, and you recover Silk as though you had landed multiple separate attacks.
If your Reaper Bind is active, you can make a single Acrobatics check against all of your targets to potentially reap extra Silk from each of them.

subclassFeature.name: Wanderer Crest
entries: The Wanderer Crest grants the following tool slots as you gain levels in this class:

subclassFeature.name: Strike of Luck
entries: You can activate your {@classFeature Needle|Weaver|Weaver|1|Weaver|Relentless Strikes} feature when you miss a melee Needle attack or when you score a Critical Hit with one.

subclassFeature.name: Wanderer's Approach
entries: When you {@action Dash|XPHB} and move at least 10 feet toward a hostile creature, you can make one melee Needle attack against them as part of same action (or bonus action) you used to Dash.

subclassFeature.name: Two Extra Attacks
entries: You can attack three times instead of once when you take the Attack action on your turn.

subclassFeature.name: Beast Crest
entries: The Beast Crest grants the following tool slots as you gain levels in this class:

subclassFeature.name: Honed Mind
entries: You gain a bonus to Initiative rolls equal to your Silk modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Beast Bind
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can spend 9 Silk points to begin a Beast Bind. This applies the following effects to your melee Needle attacks:

items: Your attack rolls are made with advantage.
You can make a single attack as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}.

When you deal damage, you can recover 1d6 Hit Points. This recovery increases to 2d6 at 5th level, 3d6 at 11th level, and 4d6 at 17th level. For every d6 you roll, add your Constitution modifier to the amount of Hit Points you recover. Similar to damage dice, these recovery dice are doubled when you land a Critical Hit (but your Constitution modifier is not added to the extra dice).

entries: These effects last for 1 minute or until you take damage.

This feature replaces your Bind feature. Unlike the original feature, the Beast Bind does not trigger enemy attacks and will still function if you are raging. If you are a multiclass Barbarian, you can enter or sustain your Rage and start a Beast Bind using the same bonus action.

subclassFeature.name: Ferocious Bind
entries: When you make a d20 roll with advantage during your Beast Bind, roll three d20s instead of two and use the highest result.

subclassFeature.name: Witch Crest
entries: The Witch Crest grants the following tool slots as you gain levels in this class:

subclassFeature.name: Witch's Curse
entries: When you choose this subclass, the DM determines whether you are cursed by secretly rolling a d20 (they choose how to interpret the result).

If you are cursed, your Silk Point maximum is reduced to 3, and you cannot equip any Tools. This can be cured with a {@spell Remove Curse|XPHB} spell or by receiving an operation from a skilled surgeon.

subclassFeature.name: Lash
entries: When you {@action Dash|XPHB} and move at least 10 feet toward a hostile creature, you can make two melee Needle attacks against them as part of same action (or bonus action) you used to Dash. You do not add your ability modifier to the damage of these attacks, unless that modifier is negative, but you recover Silk for each hit as normal.

subclassFeature.name: Witch Bind
entries: When your Bind completes and no other creatures are within 15 feet of you, you do not recover Hit Points. Otherwise, sinister tendrils lash out at all other creatures within 15 feet of you, and they must make a Constitution saving throw. Creatures take Force damage equal to the number of Hit Points you recover on a failed save, or half as much damage on a success.

subclassFeature.name: Wicked Bind
entries: When you use Witch Bind, other creatures do not make a saving throw and always take full damage from the feature.

subclassFeature.name: Architect Crest
entries: The Architect Crest grants the following tool slots as you gain levels in this class:

subclassFeature.name: Artisan
entries: You gain proficiency with one type of Artisan's Tools, such as Tinker's Tools.

subclassFeature.name: Craft Bind
entries: You no longer have an ability to use Silk Skills; instead, you channel your Silk into crafting extra Red Tools and magically granting proficiency to your travel companions.

As an action, you can spend 9 Silk points to craft extra copies of your Red Tools. These copies can be given to other friendly humanoid creatures, and they can use the Red Tools in the same manner that you do. Additionally, any of your Red Tools with the Limited property have all of their uses restored.
The Craft Bind can be interrupted by attacks in the same way that a normal Bind can.
Each Red Tool is copied once, and each copy can be given to a single ally. The copies are usable until you complete a short or long rest or until you use Craft Bind again.

You always use your own Proficiency Bonus and character level as it refers to Red Tools; {@optfeature Cogfly|Weaver} and {@optfeature Pollip Pouch|Weaver} function using your abilities. All other effects are calculated based on whoever is currently wielding the tool.

subclassFeature.name: Craft Bind Improvement
entries: When you use Craft Bind, Choose a number of creatures up to your Silk modifier who are within 10 feet of you, and each of them receives copies of all three of your Red Tools.

subclassFeature.name: Shaman Crest
entries: The Shaman Crest grants the following tool slots as you gain levels in this class:

subclassFeature.name: Blade Cast
entries: Your Needle's reach increases by 10 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Shaman's Silk
entries: You can have three Silk Skills prepared at a time, and your {@classFeature Silk Skills|Weaver|Weaver|2|Weaver|Silk Dice} are d10s rather than d8s.

subclassFeature.name: Shaman Bind
entries: If you use Bind while airborne, you immediately plummet to the ground at a speed of 100 feet per round. You take no fall damage, and the Bind begins when you touch the ground.
When you complete a Bind, you can choose one of the following effects:

items: Choose a number of creatures up to your Silk modifier within 15 feet of you. They regain Hit Points equal to half of your total restored Hit Points.
One creature of your choice that you can touch regains Hit Points equal to the full amount that you recover.

subclassFeature.name: Improved Blade Cast
entries: You have refined your Needle technique so it becomes nearly impossible to avoid. When you use your {@classFeature Needle|Weaver|Weaver|1|Weaver|Relentless Strikes} feature, the attack you missed still deals damage to the target equal to your Dexterity modifier, and you recover a Silk point as normal.
This feature cannot be used if the attack roll's result was a natural 1.

optionalfeature.name: Silkspear
entries: As an action, you throw your Needle at a target within 30 feet, with force amplified by coiled Silk. Make a ranged attack roll with your Needle. On a hit, deal damage for your Needle and extra Radiant damage equal to your {@classFeature Silk Skills|Weaver|Weaver|2|Weaver|Silk Dice}.

optionalfeature.name: Thread Storm
entries: As an action, you surround yourself in a whirl of Silk. Each creature within 15 feet of you must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking Radiant damage equal to your {@classFeature Silk Skills|Weaver|Weaver|2|Weaver|Silk Dice} on a failed save or half as much damage on a success.

Immediately afterward, you can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to extend the attack without spending additional Silk. Targets make the same saving throw as before, and you deal damage equal to your Silk Dice, but with a -4 penalty to the die size (e.g. d8s become d4s).

optionalfeature.name: Sharpdart
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can teleport up to 30 feet to a location you can see. All creatures in a line between your original position and your destination must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take Radiant damage equal to your {@classFeature Silk Skills|Weaver|Weaver|2|Weaver|Silk Dice}.

optionalfeature.name: Rune Rage
entries: As an action, you can sew rending runes upon a number of enemies that you can see equal to your proficiency bonus. Each target must make a Constitution saving throw, taking Radiant damage equal to your {@classFeature Silk Skills|Weaver|Weaver|2|Weaver|Silk Dice} on a failed save or half as much damage on a success.

optionalfeature.name: Cross Stitch
entries: As a bonus action, you can ready yourself to counter another creature's attack. The first time another creature damages you before the start of your next turn, you ignore the damage entirely, and if that creature is within 15 feet of you, it must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking Radiant damage equal to your {@classFeature Silk Skills|Weaver|Weaver|2|Weaver|Silk Dice} on a failed save or half as much damage on a success.
Starting at 17th level, this skill can be used as a reaction immediately before you take damage.

optionalfeature.name: Pale Nails
entries: As a bonus action, you conjure a number of nails equal to your proficiency bonus and send them flying to a target within 120 feet. That target takes Radiant damage equal to your {@classFeature Silk Skills|Weaver|Weaver|2|Weaver|Silk Dice}; similar to {@spell Magic Missile|XPHB} this damage is automatic unless the {@spell Shield|XPHB} spell is cast.
You can send the nails to multiple targets if you choose. If you do so, divide the damage accordingly (1 Silk Die per nail).

optionalfeature.name: Straight Pin
entries: {@damage 1d4} Piercing damage; increases to {@damage 1d6} at 5th level, {@damage 1d8} at 11th level, and {@damage 1d10} at 17th level.

entries.name: Quick
entries: This tool can be used as an action or as a bonus action.

entries.name: Finesse, Thrown (40/120 ft)
entries: You can throw this tool to make a ranged attack, and you can draw it as part of the attack. Make a ranged attack roll, using your choice of your Strength or Dexterity modifier for the attack and damage rolls.

optionalfeature.name: Longpin
entries: {@damage 1d6} Piercing damage; increases to {@damage 1d8} at 5th level, {@damage 1d10} at 11th level, and {@damage 1d12} at 17th level.
This tool ignores armor and shields. When attacking a creature, treat its AC as 10 + its Dexterity modifier.

entries.name: Finesse, Thrown (15/60 ft)
entries: You can throw this tool to make a ranged attack, and you can draw it as part of the attack. Make a ranged attack roll, using your choice of your Strength or Dexterity modifier for the attack and damage rolls.

optionalfeature.name: Sting Shard
entries: This tool hovers in the air at a point you choose within range. If there is a creature within 5 feet, it activates immediately. Otherwise, other creatures must succeed on a Perception check in order to see it, and the tool activates the first time a creature is within 5 feet of it.
When the Sting Shard activates, creatures within 5 feet must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 2d4} piercing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a success.
This tool's damage increases to {@damage 2d6} at 5th level, {@damage 2d8} at 11th level, and {@damage 2d10} at 17th level.

entries.name: Thrown (30 ft)
entries: You can throw this tool to any position you can see within range; it hovers there until it activates.

entries.name: Hidden
entries: Other creatures will only notice the tool if their passive Perception or Investigation is high enough to meet a DC of 8 + your Proficiency Bonus + your Strength or Dexterity modifier (your choice). If a creature can see you as you use the tool, they immediately make a check by rolling a d20 instead of using their passive ability.
When you take a short or long rest, you can spend a few minutes showing your tools to your travel companions. This allows them to automatically succeed any check required to notice the tool.

optionalfeature.name: Threefold Pin
entries: 1d4 Piercing damage; increases to 1d6 11th level and 1d8 at 17th level.
Each time you use this tool, you throw 3 pins to a single target, making a separate attack roll for each. You only add your ability modifier to the damage of the first pin that hits.

entries.name: Finesse, Thrown (20/40 ft)
entries: You can throw this tool to make a ranged attack, and you can draw it as part of the attack. Make a ranged attack roll, using your choice of your Strength or Dexterity modifier for the attack and damage rolls.

optionalfeature.name: Plasmium Phial
entries: You can inject yourself with Plasmium. When you do so, you gain Temporary Hit Points equal to 1d8 + your Constitution modifier. Unlike other sources, these Temporary Hit Points are added onto whatever Temporary Hit Points you currently have.

If after using the Plasmium Phial your number of Temporary Hit Points is greater than or equal to your Hit Point maximum, you immediately lose all of your Temporary Hit Points. From then on, at the start of each of your turns, you regain Hit Points equal to 1d8 + your Constitution modifier.

If {@optfeature Pollip Pouch|Weaver} is also equipped, then at the start of your next turn after using the Plasmium Phial, you immediately lose all of your Temporary Hit Points and deal Poison damage equal to the HP you lost to hostile creatures within 20 feet of you. Those creatures must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or become {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} per the Pollip Pouch description.
This tool's effects wear off when you complete a short or long rest. The die size improves as you gain character levels, increasing to 1d10 at 11th level and 1d12 at 17th level.

entries.name: Limited
entries: This tool can be used a number of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus before needing to be crafted again, either by completing a short or long rest or by completing a Craft Bind.

optionalfeature.name: Tacks
entries: When you use this tool, throw 4 tacks into a 5 foot by 5 foot square within 20 feet, or a 10 foot by 10 foot square within 40 feet.
Creatures must succeed on an Investigation check to see the tacks. Otherwise, they step on a tack when they enter the area, or they step on 2 tacks if the tacks are concentrated in a 5-foot square.
Each tack deals 1d4 damage. You don't add your ability modifier to this damage, and each tack can only deal the damage once to a single creature.
The damage increases to 1d6 at 11th level and 1d8 at 17th level.

entries.name: Limited
entries: This tool can be used a number of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus before needing to be crafted again, either by completing a short or long rest or by completing a Craft Bind.

entries.name: Thrown (20/40 ft)
entries: You can throw this tool to any position you can see within range; the tacks rest there until they damage another creature.

entries.name: Hidden
entries: Other creatures will only notice the tool if their passive Perception or Investigation is high enough to meet a DC of 8 + your Proficiency Bonus + your Strength or Dexterity modifier (your choice). If a creature can see you as you use the tool, they immediately make a check by rolling a d20 instead of using their passive ability.
When you take a short or long rest, you can spend a few minutes showing your tools to your travel companions. This allows them to automatically succeed any check required to notice the tool.

optionalfeature.name: Curveclaw
entries: 1d6 Bludgeoning damage.
If you hit a target with the Curveclaw that is at least 20 feet away from you, the target is hit twice; roll damage a second time without adding your ability modifier.
Once {@optfeature Curvesickle|Weaver} is unlocked, this tool can no longer be equipped.

entries.name: Finesse, Thrown (25 ft)
entries: You can throw this tool to make a ranged attack, and you can draw it as part of the attack. Make a ranged attack roll, using your choice of your Strength or Dexterity modifier for the attack and damage rolls.

optionalfeature.name: Flintslate
entries: This tool superheats the blade of a weapon you are holding. After using it, your attacks with this weapon deal an extra 1d4 Fire damage. This effect lasts until the end of your next turn.
This tool's damage is enhanced if you have a magic weapon, as shown in the table below:
The Flintslate's damage bonus cannot be applied to another Red Tool.

If you also have {@optfeature Pollip Pouch|Weaver} equipped, you don't deal Poison damage with each attack, but you can cause targets to become {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} and take damage on their turns.
When you are about to make a Constitution saving throw to withstand {@hazard Extreme Cold|XDMG}, you can use the Flintslate to automatically succeed on the save.

entries.name: Limited
entries: This tool can be used a number of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus before needing to be crafted again, either by completing a short or long rest or by completing a Craft Bind.

entries.name: Quick
entries: This tool can be used as an action or as a bonus action.

optionalfeature.name: Flea Brew
entries: Drinking this invigorating beverage grants the following effects:

items: Your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} increases by 10 feet.

You gain an additional action on each of your turns. That action can be used to take only the {@action Attack|XPHB} (one attack only), {@action Dash|XPHB}, {@action Disengage|XPHB}, {@action Hide|XPHB}, or {@action Utilize|XPHB} action.

entries: These effects last until the end of your next turn.

If you also have {@optfeature Pollip Pouch|Weaver} equipped, when you and a hostile creature are within 5 feet of each other for the first time on a turn while the Flea Brew is active, that creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or become {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} per the Pollip Pouch description.

entries.name: Limited
entries: This tool can be used a number of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus before needing to be crafted again, either by completing a short or long rest or by completing a Craft Bind.

entries.name: Quick
entries: This tool can be used as an action or as a bonus action.

optionalfeature.name: Pimpillo
entries: The Pimpillo explodes upon landing: each creature within 5 feet of its landing location must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking 3d6 Fire damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a success.
This tool's damage improves as you gain levels, increasing to 5d6 at 11th level and 8d6 at 17th level.

entries.name: Limited
entries: This tool can be used a number of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus before needing to be crafted again, either by completing a short or long rest or by completing a Craft Bind.

entries.name: Thrown (15 ft)
entries: This tool is thrown so that it lands at a point of your choice within range and explodes there.

optionalfeature.name: Delver's Drill
entries: This tool can only be used while airborne. You dive straight down to the target before making a melee attack roll.
The Delver's Drill deals Piercing damage and its damage die is 2d6; it increases to 2d8 at 11th level and 2d10 at 17th level.

entries.name: Quick
entries: This tool can be used as an action or as a bonus action.

entries.name: Finesse
entries: You can use either your Strength or Dexterity modifier for this tool's attack and damage rolls.

optionalfeature.name: Cogwork Wheel
entries: When thrown, this spinning blade wheel travels in a straight line for 50 feet.

When the blade comes within 5 feet of a creature, that creature must make a Strength saving throw; on a failed save it takes 2d6 Slashing damage and is pushed back 10 feet, and on a success it takes half as much damaged and isn't pushed. After a creature is pushed, it can be hit by the blade again.
This tool's damage improves as you gain levels, increasing to 2d8 at 11th level and 2d10 at 17th level.

entries.name: Thrown (50 ft)
entries: This tool is thrown onto the ground and continues to travel in a straight line until it reaches the end of its range.

optionalfeature.name: Cogfly
entries: When you release a Cogfly, it begins acting on its own. It has a flying speed of 30 feet and takes its turn immediately after yours. You choose who it attacks; it makes a single attack using your Proficiency Bonus and Dexterity modifier for its attack and damage rolls, and its damage die is 1d4. After it deals damage a number of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus, the Cogfly disappears.
The damage die improves as you gain levels, increasing to 1d6 at 11th level and 1d8 at 17th level.

entries.name: Quick
entries: This tool can be used as an action or as a bonus action.

entries.name: Limited
entries: This tool can be used a number of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus before needing to be crafted again, either by completing a short or long rest or by completing a Craft Bind.

entries.name: Thrown
entries: This tool activates when you throw it into the air.

optionalfeature.name: Currency Cannon
entries: In order to use this weapon, you must first fill it with currency as an action or bonus action. It deals Bludgeoning damage with the amount depending on the ammunition loaded:

items: copper piece ({@damage 1d8})
silver piece ({@damage 1d8}, qualifies as a {@item Silvered Weapon|XDMG})
gold or platinum piece ({@damage 2d8})

entries: When you take the Attack action, you can replace one or more attacks with a use of this tool. The damage dice improve as you gain levels, increasing to d10s at 11th level and d12s at 17th level.

entries.name: Ammunition (80/240 ft), Reload (20 shots)
entries: The cannon can hold up to 20 pieces of ammunition. Ammunition is destroyed upon being fired.

entries.name: Burst Fire
entries: As an action, you can expend 10 pieces of ammunition to spray shots in a 10-foot cube within the weapon's normal range. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or take damage. Roll the weapon's damage once, and apply it to each creature that failed the save.

optionalfeature.name: Conchcutter
entries: When you throw the Conchcutter, it launches in a straight line, ricocheting off of any walls it runs into until it has travelled a total of 75 feet.

Any creature in this tool's path must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw (DC: 8 + your Proficiency Bonus + choose either your Strength or Dexterity modifier) or take 6d4 Piercing damage. This damage improves as you gain levels, increasing to 6d6 at 11th level and 6d8 at 17th level.

entries.name: Thrown (75 ft)
entries: You activate this tool by throwing it.

optionalfeature.name: Throwing Ring
entries: 1d8 Bludgeoning damage; increases to 1d10 at 11th level and 1d12 at 17th level.

If a Throwing Ring hits a hostile creature, it can ricochet to another hostile creature if that creature is within 10 feet of it and the attack roll is high enough to meet the other creature's AC. If the ring successfully ricochets to a second creature, it then bounces back to hit the original creature a second time.
Only add your ability modifier to the damage of the first hit.

entries.name: Finesse, Thrown (30/100 ft)
entries: You can throw this tool to make a ranged attack, and you can draw it as part of the attack. Make a ranged attack roll, using your choice of your Strength or Dexterity modifier for the attack and damage rolls.

optionalfeature.name: Curvesickle
entries: 1d8 Slashing damage; improves to 1d10 at level 17.

If you hit a target with the Curveclaw that is at least 20 feet away from you, the target is hit twice; roll damage a second time without adding your ability modifier. If the target is exactly 25 feet away, it is hit 3 times.

entries.name: Finesse, Thrown (25 ft)
entries: You can throw this tool to make a ranged attack, and you can draw it as part of the attack. Make a ranged attack roll, using your choice of your Strength or Dexterity modifier for the attack and damage rolls.

optionalfeature.name: Silkshot
entries: When you craft this tool (e.g. at the end of a short or long rest), you choose one of three variations:

items: {@b Railgun.} (150/500 ft.) Deals {@damage 3d8} Radiant damage; do not add your ability modifier to the damage roll.
{@b Single shot.} (60/200 ft.) Deals {@damage 2d8} Radiant damage. This tool can replace one or more attacks you make as part of the Attack action.
{@b 3-shot burst.} (20/40 ft.) Make 3 separate attack rolls; each shot deals {@damage 1d8} Radiant damage. Only add your ability modifier to the first shot that hits.

entries: You use your Dexterity or your Silk modifier (your choice) for the Silkshot's attack and damage rolls.
When you reach 17th level, the damage dice increase to d10s.

entries.name: Silk
entries: This tool costs 1 Silk point to use. It can only be used by Weavers.

optionalfeature.name: Snare Setter
entries: When you craft this tool (e.g. at the end of a short or long rest), you choose one of two variations:

items: {@b Stake.} You throw this tool into the ground at a location within 5 feet of you and create a column of energy in a cylinder 50 feet tall with a 10-foot radius. As part of the action used to stake this tool, you can choose to angle it 45 degrees in any direction; doing so changes the angle of the cylinder.

{@b Bolas.} When you throw this tool, choose 2 locations that are within 25 feet of you and are exactly 10 feet apart. Two electical explosions occur at these locations; each one has a radius of 5 feet.

entries: Hostile creatures in the tool's area of effect must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking 8d6 Electric damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a success.
This tool's damage increases to 10d10 when you reach 17th level.

entries.name: Limited
entries: This tool can be used a number of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus before needing to be crafted again, either by completing a short or long rest or by completing a Craft Bind.

entries.name: Silk
entries: This tool costs 1 Silk point to use. It can only be used by Weavers.

entries.name: Hidden
entries: Other creatures will only notice the tool if their passive Perception or Investigation is high enough to meet a DC of 8 + your Proficiency Bonus + your Strength or Dexterity modifier (your choice). If a creature can see you as you use the tool, they immediately make a check by rolling a d20 instead of using their passive ability.
When you take a short or long rest, you can spend a few minutes showing your tools to your travel companions. This allows them to automatically succeed any check required to notice the tool.

optionalfeature.name: Voltvessels
entries: When you use this tool, you place a rune on the ground where you are standing. Creatures must succeed on an Investigation check (using your Silk save DC) to see the rune.

The first time a hostile creature enters a space within 10 feet of the rune, it explodes and deals damage to all creatures in a 15-foot radius. Creatures make a Constitution saving throw, taking 10d8 Radiant damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a success.
This tool's damage increases to 8d8 when you reach 17th level. {@optfeature Pollip Pouch|Weaver} has no effect on it.

entries.name: Limited
entries: This tool can be used a number of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus before needing to be crafted again, either by completing a short or long rest or by completing a Craft Bind.

entries.name: Thrown
entries: You activate this tool by throwing it.

optionalfeature.name: Druid's Eye
entries: When you take damage from a hostile creature, this tool creates a small reserve of green elixir. When you take damage while the tool has a reserve, the reserve disappears and you regain 1 Silk point.
Once {@optfeature Druid's Eyes|Weaver} is unlocked, this tool can no longer be equipped.

optionalfeature.name: Magma Bell
entries: As a reaction when you take Fire damage, you can divide that damage by 2.

optionalfeature.name: Warding Bell
entries: When your Bind is interrupted as a result of taking damage, the damage is prevented and each hostile creature within 15 feet of you must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 1d12} Radiant damage.
You still lose the 9 Silk points you used to start the Bind, but no additional Silk is lost.
This damage improves with your character level, increasing to {@damage 2d12} at level 5, {@damage 3d12} at level 11, and {@damage 4d12} at level 17.

optionalfeature.name: Fractured Mask
entries: When you are reduced to zero Hit Points, this tool immediately sets your number of Hit Points to be equal to your Weaver level. Doing so prevents Dead Bug's Purse from activating, but other effects that occur when you take damage (e.g. Druid's Eye) still take place.
After this tool activates, it will not activate again until you complete a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Pollip Pouch
entries: When a creature takes damage from a {@filter Red Tool|optionalfeatures|feature type=WT:R|source=Weaver}, they take an extra {@damage 1d4} Poison damage and must succeed on a Constitution saving throw (using your Silk save DC) or become Poisoned for 1 minute. While Poisoned, the target takes 1d4 Poison damage at the start of each of its turns. At the end of its turn, the target can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on a success.
This damage improves with your character level, increasing to {@damage 1d6} at level 11 and {@damage 1d8} at level 17.

optionalfeature.name: Claw Mirror
entries: When your {@classFeature Bind|Weaver|Weaver|1|Weaver} completes, all other creatures within 10 feet must make a Constitution saving throw (using your Silk save DC), taking 3d6 Radiant damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a success.
If Multibinder is also equipped, this tool activates twice: once when the Bind begins and again when it completes.
Once {@optfeature Claw Mirrors|Weaver} is unlocked, this tool can no longer be equipped.

optionalfeature.name: Multibinder
entries: You cannot use Bind if you have used any of your movement since the start of your turn. When you Bind, your Speed becomes 0 and cannot be increased.
When you regain Hit Points from your Bind, you use d10s instead of d6s. If your Bind is interrupted, you still recover Hit Points equal to half of an uninterrupted Bind.

optionalfeature.name: Pin Badge
entries: As an action, you can perform a special melee attack called a Needle Strike. The Needle Strike's effects depend on your Crest:

entries.name: Hunter Crest
entries: Make two separate Needle attack rolls against a single target within reach. If at least one of them hits, you hit the target twice with your Needle. After you perform a Needle Strike, you can make another Needle attack as a bonus action.

entries.name: Reaper Crest
entries: You make a single Needle attack that deals bonus damage equal to four times your Proficiency Bonus.

entries.name: Wanderer Crest
entries: You make five Needle attacks against a single target within reach. You do not add your ability modifier to the damage rolls, and you only recover Silk from the first attack that hits.

entries.name: Witch Crest
entries: You make two Needle attacks, and each attack can target all creatures within your Needle's reach. Immediately after making these attacks, you can use a bonus action to extend the Needle Strike; if you do so, roll a d4 and make that many additional attacks against every target.
You do not add your ability modifier to any damage rolls, and hitting the same creature multiple times does not grant additional Silk points.

entries.name: Architect Crest
entries: You make a single Needle attack; if it hits, it deals bonus damage equal to your Proficiency Bonus and counts as five hits for the purpose of activating {@optfeature Flintslate|Weaver}.

entries.name: Shaman Crest
entries: You make a single Needle attack with advantage on the attack roll. If it hits, it deals extra damage equal to your Proficiency Bonus + your Silk modifier and counts as two hits for the purpose of recovering Silk points.

optionalfeature.name: Longclaw
entries: The reach of your Needle increases by 5 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Injector Band
entries: You can perform your Bind as an action or bonus action, and it no longer triggers enemy attacks.

optionalfeature.name: Spool Extender
entries: Your Silk point maximum increases by 3.
This tool still functions after {@optfeature Dead Bug's Purse|Weaver} creates a cocoon, increasing your Silk point maximum from 9 to 12.

optionalfeature.name: Snitch Pick
entries: When you hit a target with your Clawline's ranged attack roll, you add your Dexterity modifier to the damage dealt.
Additionally, any creature hit by your Clawline's ranged attack will immediately drop half of the currency they are carrying.
If {@optfeature Thief's Mark} is also equipped, any currency dropped by a hostile creature this way is doubled.

optionalfeature.name: Volt Filament
entries: Your {@classFeature Silk Skills|Weaver|Weaver|2|Weaver|Silk Dice} are d10s rather than d8s, and any Radiant damage dealt by Silk Skills is changed to Electric.
If you have the {@class Weaver|Weaver|Shaman Crest|Shaman}, your Silk Dice become d12s.

optionalfeature.name: Druid's Eyes
entries: When you take damage from a hostile creature, this tool creates a reserve of green elixir. When you take damage while the tool has an elixir reserve, the reserve disappears and you regain 2 Silk points.

optionalfeature.name: Wispfire Lantern
entries: At the start of each of your turns, if there is a hostile creature within 60 feet of you, you lose 1 Silk point and summon a burning wisp to attack it. (Each time this effect triggers, you choose whether it happens before or after your Silk Hearts activate.)
The wisp immediately turns into a mote of fire and dives toward the nearest hostile creature (you choose if multiple creatures are the same distance away).
It uses your Silk modifier for its attack roll and deals {@damage 3d10} Fire damage on a hit.

optionalfeature.name: Weavelight
entries: The maximum number of Silk points with regard to your Silk Hearts feature increases by 1 (from 2 to 3 points, or from 3 to 4 points if you are 13th level or higher).
If at the start of your turn you have zero Silk points, you regain 2 Silk points instead of 1.

optionalfeature.name: Reserve Bind
entries: You can use Bind (or a similar feature such as Beast Bind or Craft Bind) without spending Silk.
After you use this feature, you must complete a short or long rest before you can use it again.

optionalfeature.name: Sawtooth Circlet
entries: Once on each of your turns, you can flare your Cloak and strike surrounding creatures with blades (no action required).
Each creature within 5 feet of you must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw (DC: 8 + your Proficiency Bonus + your Dexterity modifier) or take Slashing damage equal to 1d10 + your Dexterity modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Quick Sling
entries: Any time you use a Red Tool with the Thrown property, you can use 2 copies of it instead of 1, making 2 separate attack rolls if applicable. For tools with the Limited property, the tool's number of uses decreases by 2 when you do so.

optionalfeature.name: Memory Crystal
entries: This tool is magical and only deals damage to hostile creatures.

When you take damage, a crystal forms at your location. At the end of your next turn, the crystal arms itself. If there is a hostile creature within 5 feet of the crystal, it activates immediately; otherwise it activates the first time an enemy is within 5 feet of it.

When the crystal activates, enemies within 10 feet of it must make a Dexterity saving throw (using your Silk save DC), taking {@damage 2d8} piercing damage and {@damage 2d6} cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a success. The Piercing damage is considered magical for the purpose of bypassing damage resistance.
In order to notice a crystal, a creature must have a passive Perception ability that meets or exceeds your Silk save DC.

optionalfeature.name: Egg of Flealia
entries: While you are not bloodied, the cost of Silk Skills is reduced to 3 Silk points.

optionalfeature.name: Claw Mirrors
entries: When your {@classFeature Bind|Weaver|Weaver|1|Weaver} completes, all other creatures within 10 feet must make a Constitution saving throw (using your Silk save DC), taking {@damage 2d6} Radiant damage and {@damage 2d6} Necrotic damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a success.
If {@optfeature Multibinder|Weaver} is also equipped, this tool activates twice: once when the Bind begins and again when it completes.

optionalfeature.name: Wreath of Purity
entries: This tool is a magic item with 3 charges.
When you take Poison damage, you can expend 1 charge to negate the damage. When you fail an Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma saving throw, you can expend 1 charge to turn the failure into a success.
The wreath regains all of its charges when you complete a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Compass
entries: You cannot become lost by magical or nonmagical means. You always know the time of day and which way is north.
You can pinpoint your exact location if it is represented on a map you are viewing.

optionalfeature.name: Shard Pendant
entries: When a hostile creature dies within 15 feet of you, roll a d4. If the result is 4, choose a Red Tool with the Limited property. You regain one use of that tool.

optionalfeature.name: Weighted Belt
entries: Whenever you are subjected to an effect where you must make an ability check or saving throw to avoid being moved or knocked prone, you automatically succeed the check or saving throw.

optionalfeature.name: Magnetite Brooch
entries: If this tool is equipped at the end of a short or long rest, you will find a small item on the ground, such as a copper or gold piece.
The item you find might vary based on your location and your DM's discretion.

optionalfeature.name: Barbed Bracelet
entries: When you deal damage with your Needle, the damage is increased by {@damage 1d4}.
When you take damage, the damage is increased by {@damage 1d4}.
The die size grows as you gain levels, increasing to {@damage 1d6} at 11th level and {@damage 1d8} at 17th level.

optionalfeature.name: Silkspeed Anklets
entries: When you {@action Dash|XPHB}, your speed is tripled instead of doubled.
If you Dash on consecutive turns, you lose 1 Silk point for each turn after the first.

optionalfeature.name: Thief's Mark
entries: Whenever a hostile creature dies within 15 feet of you, all of that creature's currency is magically duplicated.
Every time you take damage, you lose silver pieces equal to the Hit Points of damage you took. If you are not carrying this amount of currency, one of your allies is chosen at random to lose it.

optionalfeature.name: Ascendant's Grip
entries: Your climbing speed increases by 15 feet. If a surface is physically possible to climb, you automatically succeed any ability check required to climb it.

optionalfeature.name: Dead Bug's Purse
entries: This purse is a magic item that activates when you place 500 gp inside it.

If you are reduced to zero Hit Points while this item is active, you instantly teleport to the location where you last completed a short or long rest; you can choose a number of other willing creatures up to your Silk modifier to be teleported along with you.

Any time you teleport this way, all of your Hit Points are restored. Additionally, a Silk cocoon appears at the location you teleported away from. The cocoon has 1 HP and 1 AC, and you are the only one who can see or interact with it. When you break the cocoon, you immediately regain 9 Silk points and 200 gp.

When you create a cocoon, your Silk point maximum is reduced to 9 and remains that way until the cocoon is destroyed. After creating a cocoon, you must complete a long rest before you can do so again. Each time you create a cocoon, any cocoon you created previously vanishes.

optionalfeature.name: Shell Satchel
entries: Red Tools with the Limited property gain an extra use.

optionalfeature.name: Magnetite Dice
entries: When you take damage, roll {@dice 1d12}, and if the result is 12, the damage is prevented.

If this tool fails to prevent damage, the die size decreases by 2 (to {@dice 1d8}, then {@dice 1d6}, and finally to {@dice 1d4}). When you roll the maximum result (e.g. rolling a 6 on a d6), the damage is prevented and the die size resets to {@dice 1d12}.

optionalfeature.name: Scuttlebrace
entries: As a reaction when you are targeted by an attack, you can rush up to 15 feet in any direction. When you do so, you cause the attack to miss, or for effects such as a dragon's breath weapon, you can potentially escape the area where you would take damage. This movement does not provoke opportunity attacks.
Additionally, this tool is capable of altering your body's shape. You can attempt to Hide even when only obscured by an object or creature that is Small or larger.

optionalfeature.name: Spider Strings
entries: The Needolin's radius increases to 25 feet.

As an action, you can spend 1 Silk point and use the Needolin to interrupt enemy behavior. Each hostile creature within its radius must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or become {@condition Stunned} until the start of your next turn or until the creature takes damage.
Additionally, when you make a Charisma ({@skill Performance}) check to play your Needolin, you gain a bonus to the check equal to your Weaver level.

entries.name: Silk and Soul
entries: In the Forgotten Realms, the fundamental source of magic is known as the Weave. Some adventurers interact with its flow by casting spells, but you manifest its energy in the form of Silk.
Channeling the Weave this way can lead to untold power. It also renders you vulnerable to forces such as the Dark Lady's Shadow Weave.

entries.name: Weaver Customs
entries: Much like how a Druid chooses not to use equipment made of metal, a Weaver wears a Cloak and uses a Needle in combat.

entries.name: Mastery
entries: If a feature grants you mastery with this armor, you gain the following benefits:

items: You do not take fall damage unless you are incapacitated.

While you are falling, you may activate (or deactivate) this cloak, with no action required. While active, your descent is slowed to 10 feet per round, and for every 10 feet you fall vertically, you can glide up to 20 feet in any horizontal direction you choose.

item.name: Faydown Cloak
entries: While wearing this cloak, you are protected from {@hazard Extreme Cold|XDMG} and automatically succeed the saving throw required to avoid exhaustion.

entries.name: Mastery
entries: If a feature grants you mastery with this armor, you gain all the benefits from the {@item Drifter's Cloak|Weaver} description. Additionally, you can fly up to 20 feet in any direction with no action required. After doing so, you must either stand on the ground, grab onto a wall, or hit a target with a melee weapon attack before you can fly again.

feat.name: Steel Soul
entries: You gain proficiency in Constitution saving throws. If you already have this proficiency, your Constitution score increases by 1, to a maximum of 20.

When a feature such as {@classFeature Bind|Weaver|Weaver|1|Weaver} or the Hunter's {@subclassFeature Focus|Weaver|Weaver|Hunter|Weaver|3} is interrupted as a result of taking damage, you can make a DC 10 Constitution saving throw. If you succeed, the damage you took does not interrupt any Weaver features.
Each time you use this feature after the first, the DC increases by 5. When you finish a Short or Long Rest, the DC resets to 10.

entries.name: Natural Armor
entries: You are equipped with a protective exoskeleton. When you aren't wearing armor, your AC is 13 + your Dexterity modifier. You can use your natural armor to determine your AC if the armor you wear would leave you with a lower AC. A shield's benefits apply as normal while you use your natural armor.

entries.name: Arthropod Leap
entries: You can jump up to 15 feet into the air; when you do so, you can move a horizontal distance less than or equal to the height of your jump by the time you hit the ground. This extra distance costs movement as normal.

entries.name: Martial Arts Training
entries: The damage die of your Unarmed Strikes is {@damage 1d4}, and you can use your Strength or Dexterity modifier for the attack and damage rolls.

entries.name: Prone to Frailty
entries: If your Initiative roll is a natural 1, then once the combat ends (i.e. when you stop acting in Initiative order) you immediately gain {@dice 1d4-1} levels of exhaustion. The exhaustion lasts until you complete a short or long rest.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and one other language that you and your DM agree is appropriate for your character.
